Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Intrahematomal Alteplase in Patients with Intraventricular Hemorrhage

Participants.evidence: included participants with IVH on stability CT scans

Intervention.evidence: The intervention group received minimally invasive surgery plus alteplase (MIS+alteplase), while the control group received standard medical care (SMC).

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the impact of intrahematomal alteplase on intraventricular hemorrhage (IVH) volume and functional outcomes in patients with spontaneous intracerebral hemorrhage (ICH).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the change in IVH volume (deltaIVH) from stability CT to end-of-treatment CT.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors were blinded to treatment allocation.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Of 499 patients, 310 had IVH on stability scans; 146 received MIS+alteplase and 164 received SMC.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The MIS+alteplase group showed a greater reduction in IVH volume (deltaIVH: −2.35 mL vs. −1.15 mL, p=0.02). Multivariable linear regression indicated that MIS+alteplase was associated with greater deltaIVH (beta, −0.80; 95%CI, −1.37 to −0.22; p=0.007).
